au.edu.federation.caliko.visualisation

Class FabrikLine2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.visualisation.FabrikLine2D

  • public class FabrikLine2D
extends Object
    A static class used to draw a 2D lines to represent FabrikBone2D, FabrikChain2D or FabrickStructure2D objects.

    These draw methods are only provided to assist with prototyping and debugging.

    The GLSL shaders used to draw the lines require a minimum OpenGL version of 3.3 (i.e. GLSL #version 330).

    Version:
    0.5 - 12/01/2016
    Author:
    Al Lansley

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public static void draw(FabrikBone2D bone,
                        Mat4f mvpMatrix)
        Draw this bone as a line.

        The line will be drawn in the colour and line width as taken from the bone.

        Parameters:
        bone - The bone to draw.
        mvpMatrix - The ModelViewProjection matrix with which to draw the line
        See Also:
        FabrikBone2D.setColour(Colour4f), FabrikBone2D.setLineWidth(float), Mat4f.createOrthographicProjectionMatrix(float, float, float, float, float, float)

      • draw

        public static void draw(FabrikBone2D bone,
                        float lineWidth,
                        Mat4f mvpMatrix)
        Draw this bone as a line using a specific line width.

        The line will be drawn in the colour as taken from the bone.

        Parameters:
        bone - The bone the draw.
        lineWidth - The width of the line to draw .
        mvpMatrix - The ModelViewProjection matrix with which to draw the line.
        See Also:
        FabrikBone2D.setColour(Colour4f), Mat4f.createOrthographicProjectionMatrix(float, float, float, float, float, float)

      • draw

        public void draw(FabrikBone2D bone,
                 Colour4f colour,
                 float lineWidth,
                 Mat4f mvpMatrix)
        Draw this bone as a line using a specific colour and line width.
        Parameters:
        bone - The bone the draw.
        colour - The colour of the line to draw.
        lineWidth - The width of the line to draw.
        mvpMatrix - The ModelViewProjection matrix with which to draw the line.
        See Also:
        Mat4f.createOrthographicProjectionMatrix(float, float, float, float, float, float)

      • draw

        public static void draw(FabrikChain2D chain,
                        Mat4f mvpMatrix)
        Draw the provided IK chain as a series of lines using the colour and line width properties of each bone.
        Parameters:
        chain - The chain to draw.
        mvpMatrix - The ModelViewProjection matrix with which to draw this chain.
        See Also:
        Mat4f.createOrthographicProjectionMatrix(float, float, float, float, float, float)

      • draw

        public static void draw(FabrikChain2D chain,
                        float lineWidth,
                        Mat4f mvpMatrix)
        Draw a FabrikChain2D as a series of lines.

        Each line is drawn using the specified line width, with the colour taken from the bone's FabrikBone2D.mColour property.

        Parameters:
        chain - The FabrikChain2D object to draw.
        lineWidth - The width of the line used to draw each bone in the chain.
        mvpMatrix - The ModelViewProjection matrix with which to draw the chain.

      • drawChainConstraintAngles

        public static void drawChainConstraintAngles(FabrikChain2D chain,
                                             float lineLength,
                                             float lineWidth,
                                             Mat4f mvpMatrix)
        Draw the constraint angles for each bone in an IK chain.

        Line length values must be at least 1.0f otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. Line widths may commonly be between 1.0f and 32.0f, values outside of this range may result in unspecified behaviour.

        Parameters:
        chain - The chain to draw the constraint angle lines for
        lineLength - The length of the constraint lines to be drawn
        lineWidth - The width of the constrain lines to be drawn
        mvpMatrix - The ModelViewProjection matrix used to draw our geometry
        See Also:
        Mat4f.createOrthographicProjectionMatrix(float, float, float, float, float, float)

      • draw

        public static void draw(FabrikStructure2D structure,
                        Mat4f mvpMatrix)
        Draw the provided FabrikStructure2D by drawing each chain in this structure.

        All bones in all chains are drawn with line widths and colours as per their member properties.

        Parameters:
        structure - The FabrikStructure2D to draw.
        mvpMatrix - The ModelViewProjection matrix with which to draw this chain.
        See Also:
        Mat4f.createOrthographicProjectionMatrix(float, float, float, float, float, float)

      • draw

        public static void draw(FabrikStructure2D structure,
                        float lineWidth,
                        Mat4f mvpMatrix)
        Draw the provided FabrikStructure2D by drawing each chain in this structure.

        All bones in all chains are draw with colours as per their member properties, but with the provided line width.

        Parameters:
        structure - The FabrikStructure2D to draw.
        lineWidth - The width of the lines used to draw the structure.
        mvpMatrix - The ModelViewProjection matrix with which to draw this structure.
        See Also:
        Mat4f.createOrthographicProjectionMatrix(float, float, float, float, float, float)

      • drawConstraints

        public static void drawConstraints(FabrikStructure2D structure,
                                   float lineLength,
                                   float lineWidth,
                                   Mat4f mvpMatrix)
        Draw the constraint lines for all bones in this structure.
        Parameters:
        structure - The FabrikStructure2D to draw.
        lineLength - The length of the constraint lines to draw in pixels.
        lineWidth - The width of the constraint lines to draw in pixels.
        mvpMatrix - The ModelViewProjection matrix with which to draw the constraint lines.
        See Also:
        Mat4f.createOrthographicProjectionMatrix(float, float, float, float, float, float)
